intro: Sulcorebutia verticillacantha, commonly known as the clustered stonecress, is a member of the Cactaceae family native to South America. It is a small, slow-growing cactus with a compact, multi-headed appearance, often forming dense clusters of stems. The plant features short, cylindrical stems that are typically green or bluish-green in color, with spines that are usually sparse and short. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, appearing in late spring or early summer. Sulcorebutia verticillacantha is well-suited for rock gardens and dry environments, requiring minimal water and full sun.
